thread.title: Badgers football: Prized running back recruit Antonio Williams de-commits from UW
thread.title_full: Badgers football: Prized running back recruit Antonio Williams de-commits from UW

author: JASON GALLOWAY jgalloway@madison.com, 608-252-6174
title: Badgers football: Prized running back recruit Antonio Williams de-commits from UW
text:
8 247Sports.com 
New London (N.C.) North Stanly junior Antonio Williams, a 4-star running back, has de-committed from the University of Wisconsin. 
Running back Antonio Williams, the highest-rated prospect in the University of Wisconsin’s 2016 recruiting class, decommitted from the Badgers on Wednesday afternoon. 
“After talking to the staff and through thorough thinking and praying for understanding, I have decided to re-open my recruitment and decommit from the University of Wisconsin,” Williams said via Twitter. “This is being done out of pure respect for the staff and I would not feel like an honest individual if I did not do this and took a visit to another school. I hope that all will respect my decision as I do what is best for me and my family.” 
Per multiple reports, Williams plans on taking an unofficial visit to Ohio State this weekend. 
Williams, a four-star prospect, became the first member of the 2016 class when he committed to UW in December and has played a major role in recruiting other players to join him in Madison. 
The Badgers now have 20 prospects in their 2016 class.
